title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
03:25 <DrLou> has quit  
04:20 <JuanDaugherty> has quit  
07:15 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:32 <vmassol> has quit  
07:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:41 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:46 <+mflorea> good morning guys. we need a build manager for this week. any volunteer?  
08:06 <vmassol> has quit  
08:41 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:19 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <asyd> has left #xwiki  
09:39 <vmassol> has quit  
09:40 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <+tmortagne> who's the build manager this week ?  
10:41 <+mflorea> tmortagne: I asked the same question earlier this morning. By looking at the build manager roster I'd say it is Sergiu's or Jerome's turn, unless someone else volunteers  
10:41 <+mflorea> both of them are offline though  
10:42 <+tmortagne> would be nice if it was Sergiu since he broke some validation tests ;)  
10:42 <+mflorea> :)  
10:43 <+mflorea> otherwise, from those online, jvdrean has never been the build manager (he might be busy though?)  
10:44 <+mflorea> Sergiu was earlier on Skype but now it's offline there too  
10:44 <+tmortagne> not a good sign for today :)  
10:45 <+mflorea> we might have to wait for him until afternoon (european time)  
11:00 <+mflorea> tmortagne: I have an issue with the sheet management module I'm working on. I have a component that gives me the list of sheets "registered" for a document or a class. The component methods take document references as input, and so they "query" the saved document, i.e. the one from the database/cache. I also changed edit.vm template to check if there is a sheet available (using the component I just mentioned). It works file.  
11:00 <+mflorea> The problem is only when I try to create a document, i.e. a blog post. Because the document is not saved my component doesn't detect the BlogPostClass object and so it fails to find a sheet.  
11:02 <+mflorea> the only acceptable solution I have so far is to explicitly add the sheet to the edit url (for the create form). I can get the sheet from the same component, giving the BlogPostClass doc reference  
11:04 <+mflorea> so instead of just:  
11:04 <+mflorea> /edit/Blog/MyNewBlogPost?template=Blog.BlogPostTemplate  
11:04 <+mflorea> we'll have to use:  
11:04 <+mflorea> /edit/Blog/MyNewBlogPost?template=Blog.BlogPostTemplate&sheet=Blog.BlogPostSheet  
11:04 <+tmortagne> hmm IMO the issue if that your component does not support provided document  
11:04 <+mflorea> yes  
11:04 <+tmortagne> that would be the cleanest IMO  
11:05 <+tmortagne> couldn't you have also a method that takes a document ? added to the one that takes a reference  
11:05 <+mflorea> yes, but until we have the new model in place.. I can't use XWikiDocument as param of a component interface  
11:05 <+tmortagne> you can use it's bridge representation  
11:05 <+mflorea> hmm  
11:06 <+tmortagne> XWikiDocument implements some interface just for that, don't remember  its exact name  
11:06 <+tmortagne> not super clean but better that depending on old core  
11:06 <+mflorea> DocumentModelBridge I think  
11:06 <+tmortagne> now the issue if that it's not that simple to acces the XWikiDocument object in a template  
11:07 <+mflorea> yes, that's the best option for the moment  
11:07 <+tmortagne> since that requires PR  
11:07 <+mflorea> ah  
11:07 <+mflorea> I would need to get a DocumentModelBridge from a api.Document  
11:07 <+mflorea> but  
11:07 <+tmortagne> an idea would be to make Document implements DocumentModelBridge maybe  
11:08 <+mflorea> hmm  
11:08 <+mflorea> what about passing api.Document to the script service, which gets the XWikiDocument and passed DocumentModelBridge to the real sheet management component?  
11:09 <+tmortagne> anything that manipulate Document has the same PR issue, the only way for the script service would be to access it using reflexion  
11:09 <+tmortagne> (but it's doable)  
11:09 <+mflorea> right  
11:10 <+tmortagne> at least it's quicker than making Document implements DocumentModelBridge  
11:10 <+mflorea> yes  
11:11 <+tmortagne> at least it's the right directly I think (directly providing the document instead of the reference), you could to the reflexion solution as a first version maybe and lets decide later if we want to improve it  
11:13 <+tmortagne> you are in platform anyway so it's not like its was dangerous to use reflexion  
11:13 <+mflorea> yes, the other solution is, as I said, to explicitly specify the sheet in the URL, but it's a bit too much to ask from the app devs  
11:14 <+tmortagne> yea the less the better  
11:15 <+tmortagne> we have the information it's just a matter of API, would be a shame to force to duplicate it in the URL  
11:15 <+mflorea> yep, the information is already in the attached object, but I can't access it because I'm looking at the unsaved document  
11:15 <+mflorea> s/unsaved/saved  
11:16 <+mflorea> ok, I'll use api.Document in script service  
11:16 <+mflorea> thanks Thomas  
11:16 <+tmortagne> sure but that's because you are looking at the database but you do have the information in the context so from external POV you have everything you need  
11:16 <+tmortagne> np  
11:16 <+mflorea> yep  
11:18 <+mflorea> I'll write a mail on devs though, in case someone has a better idea  
11:25 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <+tmortagne> mflorea: yep always better  
13:18 <mflorea> has quit  
13:26 <jvdrean> has quit  
13:26 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
13:31 <JuanDaugherty> has joined #xwiki  
13:34 <JuanDaugherty> in the 3.1 XE standard, the QuickLinks panel comes up with tags bounding it as a velocity macro. In the XEM, there are no such tags. AIUI Velocity is the default where programming rights aren't required. I'm observing different behavior in the two versions. Why is that?  
13:35 <JuanDaugherty> i.e. editing the QuickLinks panel  
13:35 <JuanDaugherty> (XEM SA 3.1)  
13:38 <vmassol> JuanDaugherty: XEM or XEM 3.1 should be exactly the same for tags. Only difference between both are: application and wiki manager plugins and some pages  
13:38 <vmassol> ah one thing to know though  
13:39 <vmassol> in XEM a user needs to have programming rights at the farm level to have programming rights on a given wiki  
13:40 <JuanDaugherty> ah. But that doesn't explain what I'm observing since I'm admin in both cases.  
13:40 <vmassol> local admin in XEM doesn't have PR  
13:40 <vmassol> as I said you need PR on the farm  
13:40 <vmassol> to have PR at a wiki level  
13:40 <JuanDaugherty> got it, that explains the diff  
13:41 <JuanDaugherty> wait, are you saying that applies to the manager as well as created wikis?  
13:42 <JuanDaugherty> in any case that should be hint enough  
13:42 <vmassol> this applies to users  
13:42 <vmassol> manager = ?  
13:42 <JuanDaugherty> XEM  
13:42 <vmassol> you mean owner of the subwiki?  
13:43 <JuanDaugherty> I mean the WikiManager  
13:43 <JuanDaugherty> the wiki that creates other wiki's in a farm  
13:43 <vmassol> I don't understand what you mean  
13:44 <vmassol> just to be sure:  
13:44 <vmassol> PR is only required to \*save\* pages  
13:44 <vmassol> once a page is saved with PR it can then be executed by anyone  
13:44 <vmassol> executed = rendered  
13:45 <vmassol> if you save a page requiring PR (ie using an API that requires PR) and your user doesn't have PR then PR are removed from this page and the scripts won't execute fine  
13:45 <JuanDaugherty> it's the rendering of the saved content  
13:45 <vmassol> the rendering doesn't require PR to render  
13:46 <JuanDaugherty> on XEM without the velocity tags I can introduce straight HTML  
13:46 <vmassol> what is a velocity tag?  
13:46 <vmassol> macro?  
13:46 <JuanDaugherty> {{velocity}} yes  
13:46 <vmassol> if you need to enter html you don't use the velocity macro  
13:46 <vmassol> you use the html macro  
13:47 <JuanDaugherty> {{html}} ?  
13:47 <vmassol> yes  
13:47 <vmassol> velocity will not allow you to enter any html...  
13:47 <vmassol> it'll allow you to execute velocity scripts...  
13:47 <vmassol> :)  
13:48 <vmassol> (we're talking about XWiki Syntax 2.0+ of course here, XWiki Syntax 1.0 was somehing completely different and deprecated now)  
13:53 <JuanDaugherty> neither will (the overall pkg) allow you to either embed a macro within a macro or submit two concatenated (the html after the velocity)  
13:53 <vmassol> ????  
13:54 <JuanDaugherty> Xwiki 1.0 is of zero interest, I'd never heard of xwiki till last month  
13:54 <vmassol> ok good  
13:54 <vmassol> so please forget I mentioned it!  
13:54 <vmassol> (don't keep it in your head)  
13:55 <arkub> has quit  
13:55 <JuanDaugherty> FWIU it's something from 3 years ago or more  
13:55 <vmassol> some macros can have content, some macro accept wiki syntax as content, since macros are wiki syntax all macros that accept wiki syntax can have embedded macros  
13:56 <JuanDaugherty> why did you decide to call them macros?  
13:57 <vmassol> probably because that's what they ar :)  
13:57 <vmassol> s/ar/are/  
13:57 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <vmassol> it's the most common terminology for this kind of things, actually I don't even know of any other wording  
13:58 <JuanDaugherty> these are more programming modules, unless some predecessor that's established the usage  
13:58 <JuanDaugherty> a macro is like a macro in assembly or c or a keystroke element  
13:58 <vmassol> well you can check other syntaxes  
13:58 <vmassol> and you'll see they're all called macros  
13:58 <JuanDaugherty> \*series of keystroke elements  
13:59 <JuanDaugherty> yes I did something somewhere, and I'm old so some usages people with lesser experience use take some adjustment  
13:59 <JuanDaugherty> \*did see something  
13:59 <vmassol> we could have called them "stuff" though… :)  
13:59 <vmassol> just though it was less precise  
13:59 <vmassol> s/though/thought/  
14:00 <vmassol> now go ask microsoft why they decided to call macros macros too  
14:00 <vmassol> so the short answer is that it's the established terminology  
14:00 <JuanDaugherty> right and the collision with the connotation I mentioned and the dissonance with the actual use (as programming modules) probably wasn't apparent  
14:01 <JuanDaugherty> there's a very hungry cat outside my window making the area unusually squirrel free  
14:02 <JuanDaugherty> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macro\_(computer\_science)  
14:03 <+mflorea> Both sdumitriu and jvelociter are offline. We need a build manager for this week.  
14:21 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
14:25 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
14:26 <JuanDaugherty> the thing that was tripping me up with the embedding is apparently you can get away with the slash in the closing tag of a macro  
14:26 <JuanDaugherty> that doesn't work with embedding  
14:27 <JuanDaugherty> \*get away without  
14:51 <vmassol> if you don't close a macro it's content will be the rest of the content till the end of the document  
14:51 <vmassol> s/it's/its/  
14:52 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
14:52 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
14:54 <JuanDaugherty> maybe was just a typo, the original closing tag didn't have a slash  
15:36 <pturcotte> has joined #xwiki  
15:45 <+mflorea> ui-tests stuck at the same test, testChangePasswordWithoutEnteringPasswords . No build manager for this week?  
15:46 <vmassol> mflorea: I think sergiu should be BM for this week  
15:46 <vmassol> but he's sleeping  
15:46 <+mflorea> ok, we'll wait for him to wake up  
15:46 <vmassol> basically we should count on the 4 of us: caleb, thomas, sergiu and me  
15:47 <vmassol> (of course if others can do it all the best but we should count others as bonus and be ready to do all the work with the 4 of us IMO)  
15:47 <vmassol> others = jerome, jv, anca, denis  
15:47 <+mflorea> yes..  
15:47 <vmassol> unfortunately...  
15:47 <vmassol> it requires a full time attention  
15:48 <vmassol> so only people working full time on xwiki can really do it well I think  
15:48 <+mflorea> yes, but it reduces considerably the dev time  
15:48 <vmassol> obviously all committers should never make the test fail  
15:48 <vmassol> right now sergiu made the tests fail yesterday so that's bad  
15:49 <+mflorea> yep  
15:49 <vmassol> even more bad since he's in a difference time zone from the majority of us  
15:49 <vmassol> s/difference/different/

18:24 <sdumitriu> has quit

19:50 <@sdumitriu> Hm, seems that DMZ makes the IRC work for me  
19:52 <@sdumitriu> ui tests keep blocking  
20:15 <@sdumitriu> Veeery interesting  
20:15 <@sdumitriu> I logged on the Xvnc server to see why the tests are blocking  
20:15 <@sdumitriu> There's a weird alert message with just an OK button in the middle  
20:15 <@sdumitriu> No text  
20:15 <@sdumitriu> Just a grey rectangle  
20:22 <@sdumitriu> https://picasaweb.google.com/lh/photo/hd8w1aPPc9oK3Mo9Xf4dKA?feat=directlink  
20:24 <@sdumitriu> Sorry, bad link, here's the screenshot: https://picasaweb.google.com/lh/photo/hd8w1aPPc9oK3Mo9Xf4dKHBkrlg2DMPoYSrKinEqNM8?feat=directlink  
20:29 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I think we need to use the trick we use in other tests  
20:29 <vmassol> let me find a link  
20:30 <@sdumitriu> Not sure it's a test issue  
20:30 <vmassol> I think it is  
20:30 <vmassol> I've seen this several times  
20:30 <@sdumitriu> Since it doesn't happen all the time  
20:31 <vmassol> seems sel2 has sometimes issues closing a dialob  
20:31 <vmassol> dialog  
20:31 <vmassol> but maybe it's caused by some of our code I don't know about that  
20:31 <@sdumitriu> If there was any message in the dialog we could tell where it comes from  
20:31 <vmassol> we use this for ex in a few places:  
20:31 <vmassol>         makeConfirmDialogSilent(true);  
20:31 <vmassol>         // temporary, see BaseElement#makeConfirmDialogSilent  
20:31 <vmassol>         // Note: With Firefox 3.x the following click() generates 2 calls to the server side at once which can cause  
20:31 <vmassol>         // concurrency issues. Using Firefox 6.0 (and possibly other versions) generates only a single call, as it  
20:31 <vmassol>         // should be. See http://code.google.com/p/selenium/issues/detail?id=2320 and  
20:31 <JuanDaugherty> lots of people block IRC ports  
20:31 <vmassol>         // http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6860 .  
20:31 <@sdumitriu> But so far it looks like a browser or selenium bug  
20:32 <vmassol> too much paste  
20:32 <vmassol>         makeConfirmDialogSilent(true);  
20:32 <vmassol>         // temporary, see BaseElement#makeConfirmDialogSilent  
20:32 <JuanDaugherty> a general ISP shouldn't though, like shaw or whatever  
20:32 <vmassol> found this somewhere else:  
20:32 <vmassol>         // Temporary till we understand why the following sometimes fail:  
20:32 <vmassol>         // Alert alert = getDriver().switchTo().alert();  
20:32 <vmassol>         // alert.accept();  
20:32 <vmassol>         makeConfirmDialogSilent(true);  
20:33 <vmassol> I haven't spent too much time trying to understand why it sometimes fail though  
20:33 <vmassol> At some point I read in the release notes that a sel2 version was supposed to have fixed this but apparently there are still issues  
20:35 <vmassol> can't find it any more so maybe I dreamed this: http://selenium.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/java/CHANGELOG  
20:47 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Does the pageobjects module get build before running ui-tests?  
20:47 <vmassol> yes  
20:47 <@sdumitriu> Or, does it ever get build?  
20:47 <lpereira> has joined #xwiki  
20:47 <vmassol> yes too  
20:48 <@sdumitriu> Since the last run didn't get my change  
20:48 <vmassol> enteprrise build first  
20:49 <@sdumitriu> OK, maybe they were in parallel and didn't get the new build yet  
20:49 <vmassol> I've checked in the past and it works well normally  
20:50 <vmassol> last po build was http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-pageobjects/61/  
20:50 <vmassol> triggered by [misc] Updated test  
20:50 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise/7677/  
20:51 <vmassol> did you have a commit after that?  
20:51 <@sdumitriu> No, that was it  
20:52 <@sdumitriu> OK, the test was fixed in the new build  
20:52 <@sdumitriu> So it might have been a timing or a local repository cache issue  
20:52 <vmassol> it's flickering  
20:52 <vmassol> it's not new  
20:52 <vmassol> it really looks like the issue I had with other dialog boxes  
20:52 <vmassol> (if you mean the test being stuck)  
20:52 <@sdumitriu> No, I mean the failing scheduler test  
20:53 <vmassol> ok  
20:53 <@sdumitriu> But yes, the stuck test also worked this time
